text:
“For those in this Congress who have used this crisis to loot the public treasury and serve special interests above the common good, I trust that our people and history will judge you as harshly as you deserve.” 

See my full remarks below. I voted “yes.”

https://t.co/U7bwzZCkVu
My wife and I are leaving Cookeville, headed to Washington so I can cast a vote on behalf of our district tomorrow morning. https://t.co/qpwKTUfq2b

Tonight, we are very thankful to welcome a Hendersonville family back safely to the USA from Guatemala. Bringing them and other healthy Americans home who are stranded abroad is a priority of mine. During this uncertain time, we must continue to come together to help one another.

Last night, I joined a number of my colleagues in urging Secretary @stevenmnuchin1 to move the tax filing deadline to July 15th. This is an important step of relief for Tennesseans as we continue to navigate the unique and difficult challenges presented by #COVID19. https://t.co/YbMx7rFfk2

To protect staff and constituents, and in alignment with @CDCgov recommendations and nationwide efforts to #StopTheSpread, we are canceling the remaining local office hours for March. Please call our Cookeville or Gallatin office for assistance. https://t.co/KjhLb8F5eG

My staff based in Washington, D.C. are working remotely effective Monday, March 16. Until further notice, district staff members will continue reporting to the Cookeville and Gallatin offices. Unless an in person visit is necessary, please call one of my offices for assistance.
For those reaching out to my office with concerns over COVID-19, we suggest following @CDCgov recommendations published at https://t.co/wMFMm35Pkh or call 800-CDC-INFO (800-232-4636).

Out of special concern for those at highest risk, I continue to closely follow the status of the Coronavirus. Although there are no reported cases of the virus in #TN6, we want to do everything possible to slow the spread.

https://t.co/wXBJw70AbV
Today, we join together as fellow Tennesseans, Americans, and believers in prayer to our God. May we all ask in faith for His protection and grace. #NationalDayOfPrayer https://t.co/xIGJmvpqp0
RT @TVAnews: Fort Campbell is an important partner & asset to the region. With Citizens for @FortCampbell we hosted an event highlighting t…

I am thankful @POTUS @realDonaldTrump cares about our friends and neighbors affected by the storm. I was grateful to introduce him to many of those who badly need our support in Cookeville. It was a bright spot in a dark week. 
https://t.co/au4Xx7dmqj
RT @MarshaBlackburn: I’m headed to Tennessee to meet with those affected by the tornado. @realDonaldTrump @SenAlexander @RepJohnRose https:…

Tennessee has rallied together, and now it is time for the federal assistance our state so badly needs. I have urged President @realDonaldTrump to act swiftly, and I trust he will prioritize the needs of Tennesseans during this tragic time.

https://t.co/CA57H5Fyzh

Hope you’ll tune in to SuperTalk @997wtn at 7:30 AM as @BrianWilson997 and I discuss ways to help our neighbors and communities as we begin to rebuild Middle Tennessee. Listen live: https://t.co/nGhdEv08Lk

Following this week’s tragic storms, I’ll be joining @michaelpleahy and @TheTNStar on @TalkradioWLAC at 6:30 AM this morning to discuss rescue and recovery efforts in #TN6. Listen live here: https://t.co/PPdTZBiL3V
RT @AlexApple_: .@RepJohnRose represents Putnam County: “it is inspiring to see the outpouring of volunteers, and it is a unique indication…

Our gratitude goes out to all who have volunteered to help those in need and rebuild our communities. I remain fully committed to helping Middle Tennessee rise from this tragedy. https://t.co/BKlDu73bxk
As we assessed the heartbreaking damage and discussed the ongoing recovery efforts, I witnessed great compassion exhibited by countless Tennesseans. https://t.co/cK86TkXB4j
Today, I have been on the ground with our local officials and first responders in Putnam County and Wilson County. These folks are doing life-saving work. https://t.co/UOJrnBdJwO

I stand today with those affected by this disaster and pledge every effort will be made to give shelter to those who need it, give care to those who are hurt, and give assistance in the critical effort to recover and rebuild.

View my full remarks here⬇️
https://t.co/qyuHjVo9Hz

To help in recovery efforts, please consider giving blood at CRMC or Blood Assurance. You can also email helpnow@putnamcountytn.gov

https://t.co/MNgYqhZWek
I joined Brent Fleshman and Zimmer Broadcasting this morning to discuss ways to help and recovery efforts underway. #CookevilleStrong https://t.co/zYXvOkED8I

Last night, our family returned home to Cookeville so that today I can meet with local officials and first responders to gather as much information as possible to help in getting this area the federal assistance it needs.
Our Tennessee Congressional delegation stands ready to support @GovBillLee, local officials, and first responders. The safety of Tennesseans remains my top priority. https://t.co/J0ttbl2Uxj

In times of tragedy, Tennesseans know they can count on the Volunteer spirit of friends and neighbors. If you want to help in response to last night’s devastating storms, @MtJulietPolice has set up a volunteer portal. For more information, visit: https://t.co/ZKgAIEbOne

As the damage is assessed from last night's storm, I hope you will join me in praying for the families of those who were killed and for the full recovery of those who may have been injured. 
https://t.co/IkOtZ2GPML
Thanks to @TNDeptofHealth Commissioner Lisa Piercey for providing me an update on the Department’s work in Tennessee. Their efforts are critical for all Tennesseans. https://t.co/suuWjciyNt

Thank you to Tennessee Commissioner of Veterans Services Courtney Rogers for meeting with me this week to discuss our shared commitment to Tennessee’s veterans. We will always owe a debt of gratitude to the brave men and women who have served our country. https://t.co/hw9H6bScpH

Tennesseans depend on our state’s roadway and waterway systems every day. I was happy to sit down with TN Commissioner of Transportation Clay Bright and his @myTDOT team in my Washington, D.C. office to discuss continued improvements to Tennessee's transportation system for #TN6. https://t.co/ieHH4iHp7l

I am grateful to the many Tennesseans who traveled to Washington, D.C., this week to discuss the issues that matter at home. A special thanks to TN Municipal Electric Power Association, TN Association of Broadcasters, and TN Credit Union League for coming by my office. https://t.co/SZF7iy8ydr

As a former TN Commissioner of Agriculture, it’s always great to see my friend and our state’s @TNAgCommish, Dr. Charlie Hatcher. Last night, I was proud to welcome him to Washington, D.C. Thank you, Dr. Hatcher, for your work on behalf of our fellow Tennesseans. https://t.co/Sb8SusgOxm
This week, we celebrate @NationalFFA Week. I’m proud of my roots in @TNFFA, and I’m proud of the many students across #TN6 who are active members today. https://t.co/rUH8yvulLF

I enjoyed our roundtable discussion with the class members of Leadership Cumberland yesterday. I am proud of the work these Tennesseans are doing to see continued growth and prosperity in Cumberland County. https://t.co/j30YOg5gys

We came together in Cookeville last night for the Cookeville-Putnam County Chamber of Commerce Annual Dinner, honoring area business and industry leaders. It was a privilege to congratulate retiring Chamber Director George Halford on a distinguished career. #TN6 https://t.co/OpJ3Zqwdsn

I appreciated the opportunity to visit with constituents at the White House Area Chamber of Commerce luncheon today. It was wonderful to report on the great economy we are enjoying here in #TN6 and across the country. https://t.co/tUlL8Bpw6D

Today, we celebrate our first president and the faithful many who have followed in leading the United States. We pray God’s continued blessings on @POTUS as he leads our nation. https://t.co/kppTQWOyLO

We needed to send a message to the Iranians that their continued meddling in Middle Eastern affairs and destabilizing of Iraq, Syria and Lebanon, and terrorist sponsorship directed towards Israel will not be tolerated.

Thank you, @POTUS.

https://t.co/BHXY6jt0qD
@USDA @SecretarySonny @RepDavidKustoff Read my full release here ⬇️ https://t.co/vUPy1AijHX

@USDA @SecretarySonny @RepDavidKustoff I thank my friend and fellow Tennessean, @RepDavidKustoff,  for his leadership on this critical conversation. Together, we are seeking solutions for Tennesseans, and I know the Trump Admin will continue seeking relief for those working in TN's hardwood lumber industry, as well.

Today, @USDA @SecretarySonny provided an in-depth report on the continued progress of a Phase One trade deal with China, specifically as it relates to the hardwood lumber industry. In Tennessee, nearly 38,000 families rely on the hardwood lumber industry as a way of life. https://t.co/S2IvFiE93d
Thanks to the Tennessee @SpecialOlympics delegation for sharing their stories with me today. Tennessee can be proud of these student athletes. https://t.co/An6ljeEcC7

I was proud to welcome Tennessee Treasurer David Lillard and Assistant Treasurer Ashley Nabors to my office in Washington, D.C., today. I'm thankful for their work on behalf of Tennesseans at the @TNTreasuryDept. https://t.co/CS5OLBpDfD

Deputy District Director Ray Render and Caseworker Kim Mash have servant hearts. Daily, they work hard for constituents in Sumner and surrounding counties. Thanks to the @gallatinchamber for hosting Ray and my wife, Chelsea, at the monthly luncheon today while I am in Washington. https://t.co/JZ6dCHyuQA
My East Tennessee colleagues, @RepTimBurchett and @DrPhilRoe, Saw the Light with a bluegrass band this morning. Making Tennessee proud! #NPB https://t.co/dydHLyXVbB

There's no better way to start the day than in prayer to our Heavenly Father with men and women from across the aisle and from across the world. May God bless us all today. #NPB https://t.co/0jFtmcYyaM

I applaud President @realDonaldTrump for his relentless optimism and work for the American people during the past three years as House Democrats played political games.

https://t.co/XksuBBuuy6

President @realDonaldTrump is keeping his promises to the American people and delivering results for Tennesseans. #SOTU

https://t.co/M2TxduZzBZ

@realDonaldTrump At the #SOTU, @POTUS rightfully put Charles McGee in the spotlight. It is impossible to fully grasp the struggles Charles overcame, racism chief among them. A Tuskegee Airman, valiant service to the USA, a strong family, and the passing of the torch - the American Dream embodied.

@realDonaldTrump Rush Limbaugh helped give conservatives a voice in the media. I am saddened by his recent diagnosis of cancer. To all those battling cancer, you are in my prayers. Thanks to President @realDonaldTrump for honoring Rush at the #SOTU last night with the #MedalOfFreedom.

@realDonaldTrump Ellie Schneider attended last night's #SOTU as a precious reminder of the power of life. She was born prematurely at only 21 weeks. Today, she is a healthy toddler. Late term abortions -- happening even later than Ellie's birth -- are truly heartbreaking. All babies deserve life.

Last night at the #SOTU, President @realDonaldTrump inspired us all through the stories of our fellow Americans. Their extraordinary sacrifices, service, and successes encourage us all to continue the work of the #GreatAmericanComeback. 
Here are some of their stories ⬇️
Tonight, @POTUS detailed an optimistic and inspiring vision for our country. #SOTU https://t.co/nRKovsWPM5

Tonight in the #SOTU, I expect to see @POTUS outline an optimistic vision for our country. Under his leadership, we are safer and more prosperous than ever, and I am proud to support his America First policies in Congress. https://t.co/vVjm8ZeJvn
Joining @michaelpleahy on The Tennessee Star Report this morning. Looking forward to discussing what we expect to hear from @POTUS tonight in the #SOTU. Tune in now here: https://t.co/ElvTXuPArZ

@FinancialCmte @USOCC @FDICgov Up next in @FinancialCmte, I’ll be outlining the importance of preserving our state-regulated insurance industry. @TNCommerceInsur handles these issues best for Tennesseans when the federal government stays out of the way.

It is a great day for Tennessee farmers, workers, and families. Today, President @realDonaldTrump signed the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement, marking a great win for economic growth, agriculture market expansion, digital trade, and new American jobs. https://t.co/lxiS3rj4Zz

We have a full day in @FinancialCmte. I hope you’ll tune in as we discuss @USOCC and @FDICgov’s modernization proposal to meet 21st century needs of consumers and underserved communities. 

https://t.co/21C3Cq4FPL
Today, on the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz, #WeRemember the unfathomable loss of life in the Holocaust. Together, we renew our pledge, #NeverAgain. https://t.co/x0IEqCNfFp

I am proud to have been given an “A” rating, the highest rating possible, on @SBAList's National Pro-Life Scorecard.
 
In this new decade, may our country’s legacy be of life and a new generation of hope. https://t.co/fYmGQSMh8S

Unipres USA is a big job creator in Sumner County, employing close to one thousand Tennesseans. I was proud to visit with their leadership yesterday, and I enjoyed touring their facility to meet more of the team in Portland, TN. https://t.co/yCpW26izxQ

It was great to join 130 Wonder Porcelain employees in Lebanon yesterday for town hall discussions on immigration, national security, and our country's strong economic growth. Special thanks to Plant Manager Michael Kephart for having me. https://t.co/YlkxYt1xYg
RT @nrlc: Thank you @RepJohnRose (R-TN) for standing firm for life!  @tnrighttolife  https://t.co/WRRLqZhz5h
RT @tnrighttolife: #ProLife TN Congressman @RepJohnRose: “Today I call on my colleagues to search their souls, just as Ms. McCorvey—‘Jane R…

Who are we to decide which precious children designed by God have the chance to live on this earth and which do not? #NationalSanctityofHumanLifeDay 

https://t.co/ti1VWeYrue

It's always good to hear directly from the folks I am proud to represent. Yesterday, I enjoyed meeting with the Communications Workers of America, as well as meeting with the team at Tsubaki and seeing their work firsthand. https://t.co/NDCCwKtIBI

Today, I was happy to provide an update on my work in Washington, D.C., at the Portland Chamber of Commerce luncheon. I also appreciated visiting M Pack Solutions. Small businesses in #TN6 are critical for our communities' continued growth and success. https://t.co/Ghc230Yp82
Live in studio this morning on News Talk 107.7 and 1400 The Hub in Cookeville with Brent Fleshman and Lindsay McReynolds. I hope you tune in and start your day with us. https://t.co/BntG4OWKgW
Today, we honor the life and legacy of Martin Luther King, Jr. We are inspired by his work and remember his sacrifice. https://t.co/vCjn44hoZO

Our hearts are with all people striving for freedom, especially those living under an oppressive Iranian regime that seeks the USA's demise. It's shameful that House Democrats refuse to consider @GOPLeader’s resolution, which I cosponsored, backing freedom for the Iranian people.

It was good to have Chelsea and Guy in DC this week to kick off the new year. We are thinking of every family and individual as 2020 takes off and we all three wish the best for each of you. https://t.co/JWW7HDN2BL

Tennesseans who work in agriculture to make their living are excited President @realDonaldTrump has negotiated phase one of a trade deal with China. We know that what is good for Tennessee farmers is also good for our state.

https://t.co/aUXRyE5ZxB

Our men and women in uniform remain in my prayers, and I am thankful the United States suffered no casualties in Iraq last night. I stand strong with our @POTUS who is ready to take decisive action when necessary to protect our nation and our allies. https://t.co/G5w2sG2gsT

I'm proud to cosponsor @RepMarkMeadows' resolution admonishing Speaker Pelosi for playing political games by not sending the articles of impeachment to the Senate. The constitution does not grant the Speaker the power to dictate the terms of a Senate impeachment trial.

We had a great visit at Haven of Hope in Smithville, yesterday. I also appreciated meeting with DeKalb County Mayor Tim Stribling and Smithville Mayor Josh Miller. I appreciate their continued leadership in DeKalb County for our constituents in the Sixth District. https://t.co/nyds10noto

If you are in need of assistance with federal agencies, please meet with us tomorrow in Sparta, Lebanon, Woodbury, Crossville, or Springfield. Details for all local office hours are available on my website here: https://t.co/KjhLb8F5eG
I enjoyed visiting with the kind folks at the DeKalb County Senior Center today. A special thanks to Pam Redmon, the center's director, for the warm welcome. https://t.co/BnVc7TANAB

It was wonderful to join Senator @PaulBaileyforTN and House Speaker @CSexton25 at this morning's legislative breakfast with the Crossville-Cumberland County Chamber of Commerce. Hearing directly from constituents makes for a great start to the week. https://t.co/T8VEMLTdKe

Representative @DrPhilRoe has made Tennessee proud through his leadership in Congress, as well as his service in the United States Army. I look forward to continuing to work alongside Rep. Roe in the House this year as he finishes a strong legacy of service to Tennessee.

Rural Tennessee matters. Those families, communities, businesses, and farmers should never be ignored. Trousdale and all of the rural counties within #TN6 matter to me. As 2020 begins, I am committed to being your voice in Washington 24/7, 365.

https://t.co/bKiBEwSQ96
